debug.summary:
```js
         Execution Time: {active#duration(MS)}ms
    Variables Committed: {committed}
Database Execution Time: {database#duration(MS)}ms
   Total Execution Time: {total#duration(MS)}ms
```

disabledIn.default: Cannot be used in the arguments to {subtagNames#map(\{{}\})#join(, | or )}

bot.name: Blargbot
bot.description: Subtags that integrate with blargbot's custom functions.

user.name: User
user.description: Subtags that interact with users.

server.name: Server variables
server.description:
Server variables (also referred to as Guild variables) are commonly used if you wish to store data on a per server level. They are however stored in 2 separate 'pools', one for tags and one for custom commands, meaning they cannot be used to pass data between the two
This makes then very useful for communicating data between tags that are intended to be used within 1 server at a time.

author.name: Author variables
author.description:
Author variables are stored against the author of the tag, meaning that only tags made by you can access or edit your author variables.
These are very useful when you have a set of tags that are designed to be used by people between servers, effectively allowing servers to communicate with each other.

global.name: Global variables
global.description:
Global variables are completely public, anyone can read **OR EDIT** your global variables.
These are very useful if you like pain.

temporary.name: Temporary variables
temporary.description:
Temporary variables are never stored to the database, meaning they are by far the fastest variable type.
If you are working with data which you only need to store for later use within the same tag call, then you should use temporary variables over any other type

local.name: Local variables
local.description:
Local variables are the default variable type, only usable if your variable name doesn't start with one of the other prefixes. These variables are only accessible by the tag that created them, meaning there is no possibility to share the values with any other tag.
These are useful if you are intending to create a single tag which is usable anywhere, as the variables are not confined to a single server, just a single tag

default.description: Takes `values` and joins them together to form a single array. If `values` is an array, it's flattened into the resulting array.
default.exampleOut:
Two arrays: ["this","is","an","array"]
Strings and an array: ["a","b","c", 1, 2, 3]
default.exampleCode:
Two arrays: \{concat;["this", "is"];["an", "array"]\}
Strings and an array: \{concat;a;b;c;[1, 2, 3]\}

default.description:
For every element in `array`, a variable called `variable` will be set and `code` will be executed. Returns a new array containing all the elements that returned the value `true`.

 While inside the `code` parameter, none of the following subtags may be used: {disabled#map(`\{{}\}`)#join(, )}
Determines whether `text` is a valid array.
Joins the elements of `array` together with `text` as the separator.

Provides a way to populate an array by executing a function on each of its elements, more info [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/map)
For every element in `array`, a variable called `variable` will be set to the current element. The output of `function` will be the new value of the element. This will return the new array, and will not modify the original.
Returns the last element in `array`. If provided a variable, this will remove the last element from `array`as well.
Pushes `values` onto the end of `array`. If provided a variable, this will update the original variable. Otherwise, it will simply output the new array.
Returns the first element in `array`. If used with a variable this will remove the first element from `array` as well.

array.description: Shuffles the `\{args\}` the user provided, or the elements of `array`. If used with a variable this will modify the original array

default.description: Grabs elements between the zero-indexed `start` and `end` points (inclusive) from `array`.
Sorts the `array` in ascending order. If `descending` is provided, sorts in descending order. If provided a variable, will modify the original `array`.

splice.description:
If used with a variable this will modify the original array.
Returns an array of removed items.

replace.description: Removes `deleteCount` elements from `array` starting at `start`. Then, adds each `item` at that position in `array`. Returns the removed items.

default.description: Splits `text` using `splitter`, and the returns an array.
Executes `subtag`, using the `args` as parameters. If `args` is an array, it will get deconstructed to it's individual elements.

all.exampleIn: Hello world! BBtag is so cool
all.exampleOut: You said Hello world! BBtag is so cool

indexed.description: Gets a word from the user input at the `index` position
indexed.exampleIn: Hello world! BBtag is so cool

range.description: Gets all the words in the user input from `start` up to `end`. If `end` is `n` then all words after `start` will be returned
range.exampleIn: Hello world! BBtag is so cool

default.description: Gets the name of the current tag or custom command.

commit.description:
For optimization reasons, variables are not stored in the database immediately when you use `\{set\}`. Instead they are cached, and will be saved to the database when the tag finishes. If you have some `variables` that you need to be saved to the database immediately, use this to force an update right now.
This comes at a slight performance cost, so use only when needed.
`variables` defaults to all values accessed up to this point.
`\{rollback\}` is the counterpart to this.

default.description: Adds the specified text to the debug output. This output is only shown via `tag debug`, `ccommand debug`, `tag test debug` and `ccommand test debug`.The line number is also included in the debug entry
Dumps the provided text to a blargbot output page. These expire after 7 days.

Executes the `name` tag, giving it `args` as the input. Useful for modules.
`\{execTag\}` executes the tag as if its code was in the root command.
default.exampleOut: Let me do a tag for you. User#1111 has paid their respects. Total respects given: 5
default.exampleCode: Let me do a tag for you. \{execTag;f\}

default.description:
Executes the `name` custom command, giving it `args` as the input. Useful for modules.
`\{execCustomCommand\}` executes the command as if its code was in the root command.
default.exampleOut: Let me do a command for you. User#1111 has paid their respects. Total respects given: 5
default.exampleCode: Let me do a command for you. \{execCustomCommand;f\}

clear.description: Should any tag fail to parse, it will be replaced with `message` instead of an error.

default.description: Returns the value of the specified case-sensitive flag code. Use `_` to get the values without a flag.
Returns an array of all flags provided.
Returns `true` or `false`, depending on whether the specified case-sensitive flag code has been set or not.

Defines a function called `name`. Functions are called in the same way as subtags, however they are prefixed with `func.`. While inside the `code` block of a function, you may use the `params`, `paramsArray` and `paramsLength` subtags to access the values passed to the function. These function identically to their `args` counterparts. 

Please note that there is a recursion limit of 200 which is also shared by `\{execTag\}`, `\{execCustomCommand\}` and `\{inject\}`.

value.description:
Returns the stored variable `varName`.
You can use a character prefix to determine the scope of your variable.
Valid scopes are: {scopes#map({prefix#bool(`{}`|no prefix)} ({name}))#join(, | and )}. For more information, use `b!t docs variable` or `b!cc docs variable`
value.exampleOut:
This is local var1
This is temporary var2

index.description: When variable `name` is an array this will return the element at index `index`. If `index` is empty the entire array will be returned. If variable is not an array it will return the whole variable.

default.description: Executes any arbitrary BBTag that is within `code` and returns the result. Useful for making dynamic code, or as a testing tool (`\{inject;\{args\}\}`)

Provides read/write locking functionality for bbtag. This is a very advanced feature, so it is recommended that you first [read about the concept of locks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lock_(computer_science)).

In simple terms, a lock allows commands running at the same time to cooperate and wait for each other to finish what they are doing before "releasing the lock" and letting other commands use that lock. This can be used to secure against data being edited by 2 things at the same time, which can cause inconsistencies.

There can be multiple `read` locks held at once or a single `write` lock. This means that if all your command is doing is reading some data then as long as nothing is writing to it, it will be allowed, otherwise the command will wait until it can acquire a lock.

`mode` must be either `read` or `write`.
`key` can be anything. This follows the same scoping rules as variables do.
`code` will be run once the lock is acquired
default.exampleOut:
Start
Middle
End
Start
Middle
End
This order is guaranteed always. Without a lock it isn't

modLog.description: If `moderator` is not provided or left empty, it will default to blargbot.

default.description: Creates a custom modLog entry with the given `action` and `user` with `reason`. `color` can be a [HTML color](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp), hex, (r,g,b) or a valid color number. .
default.exampleOut: You did a bad! (modLog entry with white embed colour and reason 'They did a bad!')
default.exampleCode: You did a bad! \{modLog;Bad;\{userId\};;They did a bad;#ffffff\}

default.description: Marks the output as being NSFW, and only to be sent in NSFW channels. A requirement for any tag with NSFW content. `message` is the error to show

all.description: Gets the whole input given to the current function call
all.exampleOut: You gave the parameters `Hello world! BBtag is so cool`
all.exampleCode:
\{func;test;You gave the parameters `\{params\}`\}
\{func.test;Hello world!;BBtag is so cool\}

indexed.description: Gets a parameter passed to the current function call
indexed.exampleCode:
\{func;test;The first parameter is `\{params;0\}`\}
\{func.test;Hello world!;BBtag is so cool\}

range.description: Gets all the parameters given from `start` up to `end`. If `end` is `n` then all parameters after `start` will be returned

default.description: Gets the parameters passed to the current function as an array
Gets the number of parameters passed to the current function
Gets the command prefix used to call this bbtag.
Tells any subtags that rely on a `quiet` field to be/not be quiet based on `isQuiet. `isQuiet` must be a boolean
Sets the reason for the next API call (ex. roleAdd, roleRemove, ban, etc.). If `reason` is empty the reason will be empty
default.exampleOut: ("This will show up in the audit logs" showed up)
default.exampleCode: \{reason;This will show up in the audit logs!\}\{roleAdd;111111111111\}

request.description:
Only certain whitelisted domains can be used for `url`. See [here](https://blargbot.xyz/domains) for the list.The output is a JSON object with the following structure. It is recommended to use \{jsonGet\} to navigate it.
```json
\{
  "body": \{\}, // the body of the request
  "status": 200, // the HTTP status code
  "statusText": "OK", // the human readable translation of the status code
  "date": "Thu, 1 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT", // the date sent in the headers
  "contentType": "application/json", // the content type of the response
  "url": "https://fancy.url/here" // the url that was requested
\}
```

default.description: Stops execution of the tag and returns what has been parsed. If `force` is `true` then it will also return from any tags calling this tag.
default.exampleCode: This will display. \{return\} This will not.

rollback.description:
For optimization reasons, variables are not stored in the database immediately when you use `\{set\}`. Instead they are cached, and will be saved to the database when the tag finishes. If you have some `variables` that you don't want to be changed, you can use this to revert them back to their value at the start of the tag, or the most recent `\{commit\}`.
`variables` defaults to all values accessed up to this point.
`\{commit\}` is the counterpart to this.

value.description:
Stores `value` under `name`. These variables are saved between sessions. You can use a character prefix to determine the scope of your variable.
Valid scopes are: {scopes#map({prefix#bool(`{}`|no prefix)} ({name}))#join(, | and )}.
For performance reasons, variables are not immediately stored to the database. See `\{commit\}` and `\{rollback\}`for more information, or use `b!t docs variable` or `b!cc docs variable`
value.exampleOut:
This is local var1
This is temporary var2

array.description:
Stores an array under `name`.
When getting the array, you'll notice it retrieved an object, In this object `v` is the array itself, and `n` is the `name` of the variable. If the array itself needs to be returned instead of object, in for example `\{jSet;;array;\{get;~array\}\}`, you can use `\{slice;<arrayName>;0\}`. In array subtags `\{get\} will work as intended.`

default.description: Pauses the current tag for the specified amount of time. Maximum is 5 minutes
Checks to see if `subtag` exists.
Sets whether error messages in the lookup system (query canceled, nothing found) should be suppressed. `value` must be a boolean
Throws `error`.
Executes `code` after `duration`. Three timers are allowed per custom command, with no recursive timers.
Returns an array of category ids on the current guild.

current.description: Returns the category id of the current channel.

channel.description: Returns the category id of the provided `channel`. If the provided `channel` is a category this returns nothing. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or nothing if `quiet` is `true`.

default.description:
Creates a channel with the specified `options` of type `type``options` is a JSON object, containing any or all of the following properties:
- `topic`
- `nsfw`
- `parentId`
- `reason` (displayed in audit log)
- `rateLimitPerUser`
- `bitrate` (voice)
- `userLimit` (voice)
Returns the new channel's id.
Deletes the provided `channel`.

Edits a channel with the given information.
`options` is a JSON object, containing any or all of the following properties:
- `name`
- `topic`
- `nsfw`
- `parentId`
- `reason` (displayed in audit log)
- `rateLimitPerUser`
- `bitrate` (voice)
- `userLimit` (voice)
Returns the channel's id.

current.description: Returns the id of the current channel.

channel.description: Returns the id of the given channel. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or nothing if `quiet` is `true`.

default.description: Checks if `channel` is a category. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or `false` if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description: Checks if the current channel is a NSFW channel.

channel.description: Checks if `channel` is a NSFW channel. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or `false` if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description: Checks if the current channel is a text channel.
current.exampleOut: Yeah you can write stuff here
current.exampleCode: \{if;\{channelIsText\};Yeah you can write stuff here;How did you even call the command?\}

channel.description: Checks if `channel` is a text channel. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or `false` if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description: Checks if the current channel is a thread channel.
current.exampleOut: Cool, this is a thread channel!
current.exampleCode: \{if;\{channelIsThread\};Cool, this is a thread channel!;Boo, this is a regular text channel\}

channel.description: Checks if `channel` is a thread channel. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or `false` if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description: Checks if the current channel is a voice channel.
current.exampleOut: Yeah you can write stuff here
current.exampleCode: \{if;\{channelIsVoice\};How did you even call the command?;Yeah you can write stuff here\}

channel.description: Checks if `channel` is a voice channel. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or `false` if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description: Returns the name of the current channel.

channel.description: Returns the name of the given `channel`. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or nothing if `quiet` is `true`.

channelPosition.description: The position is the index per channel type (text, voice or category) in the channel list.

current.description: Returns the position of the current channel.

channel.description: Returns the position of the given `channel`. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or nothing if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description: Returns an array of channel ids in the current guild

channel.description: Returns an array of channel ids in within the given `category`. If `category` is not a category, returns an empty array. If `category` cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or nothing if `quiet` is `true`.

current.description:
Deletes the permission overwrites of `memberId|roleId` in `channel`.
Returns the channel's id.

channel.description:
Sets the permissions of a `member` or `role` in `channel`
`type` is either `member` or `role`, and `memberId|roleId` corresponds to the id of the member or role.
Provide `allow` and `deny` as numbers, which can be calculated [here](https://discordapi.com/permissions.html). Returns the channel's id.

default.description: Moves a channel to the provided position.

current.description: Returns the type the current channel.

channel.description: Returns the type the given `channel`. If it cannot be found returns `No channel found`, or nothing if `quiet` is `true`.

lastMessageId.description: Returns nothing if the channel doesn't have any messages.

current.description: Returns the messageId of the last message in the current channel.

channel.description: Returns the messageId of the last message in `channel`.

clearCurrent.description: Removes slow mode for the current channel.

clearChannel.description: Removes slow mode for the given `channel`

setCurrent.description: Enables slow mode in the current channel and set the cooldown to `time`.

setChannel.description: Enables slow mode in `channel` and set the cooldown to `time`.
setChannel.exampleOut:
(set slow mode cooldown to 10 seconds in testing-grounds)
(set slow mode to 50s in the current channel)

default.description: Creates a emoji with the given name and image. `image` is either a link to an image, or a base64 encoded data url (`data:<content-type>;base64,<base64-data>`). You may need to use \{semi\} for the latter.`roles`, if provided, will restrict the emoji's usage to the specified roles. Must be an array of roles.Returns the new emojis's id.
Deletes an emoji with the provided `id`

emojis.description: Please note that Discord will remove all the emojis from a message which contains an emoji that blargbot can't use. For example, blargbot can't use a role-restricted emoji if it doesn't have the role. Learn more [here](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/emoji).

all.description: Returns an array of emojis in the current guild.

forRole.description: Returns an array of emojis whitelisted for the provided `role`

default.description: Returns an array of banned users in the current guild.

Returns the date the current guild was created, in UTC+0. If a `format` code is specified, the date is formatted accordingly. Leave blank for default formatting. See the [moment documentation](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) for more information.
default.exampleCode: This guild was created on \{guildCreatedAt;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss\}

default.description: Returns an array of guild feature strings. For a full list click [this link](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#guild-object-guild-features).
Returns the icon of the current guild. If it doesn't exist returns nothing.
Returns the id of the current guild.
Returns an array of user ids of the members on the current guild.
Returns the name of the current guild.
Returns the id of the guild's owner.

Updates the current guild's icon with the provided image. `image` is either a link to an image, or a base64 encoded data url (`data:<content-type>;base64,<base64-data>`). You may need to use \{semi\} for the latter.
Returns the number of members on the current guild.
Defines a raw JSON object. Usage of subtags is disabled in `input`, inside `input` all brackets are required to match.
Using the `input` as a base, cleans up the JSON file structure, parsing stringified nested objects/arrays. Will not mutate the original object.

parse.description:
Gets a json value. Works with arrays too!
`input` can be a JSON object, array, or string. If a string is provided, a variable with the same name will be used.

path.description:
Navigates the path of a JSON object. Works with arrays too!
`input` can be a JSON object, array, or string. If a string is provided, a variable with the same name will be used.
`path` is a dot-noted series of properties.

default.description:
Retrieves all keys from provided the JSON object. `object` can be a JSON object, array, or string. If a string is provided, a variable with the same name will be used.
`path` is a dot-noted series of properties.

delete.description: Deletes the value at `path`. `input` can be a JSON object or array

set.description: Using the `input` as a base, navigates the provided dot-notated `path` and assigns the `value`. `input` can be a JSON object, array, or string. If a string is provided, a variable with the same name will be used.If `create` is not empty, will create/convert any missing keys.

create.description: Using the `input` as a base, navigates the provided dot-notated `path` and assigns the `value`. `input` can be a JSON object, array, or string. If a string is provided, a variable with the same name will be used.If `create` is not empty, will create/convert any missing keys.

default.description:
Sorts an array of objects based on the provided `path`.
`path` is a dot-noted series of properties.
If `descending` is provided, sorts in descending order.
If provided a variable, will modify the original `array`.
Pretty-prints the provided JSON `input` with the provided `indent`.

Retrieves all values from provided the JSON object. `object` can be a JSON object, array, or string. If a string is provided, a variable with the same name will be used.
`path` is a dot-noted series of properties.

To start, `variable` is set to `initial`. Then, the tag will loop, first checking `variable` against `limit` using `comparison`. If the check succeeds, `code` will be run before `variable` being incremented by `increment` and the cycle repeating.
This is very useful for repeating an action (or similar action) a set number of times. Edits to `variable` inside `code` will be ignored

For every element in `array`, a variable called `variable` will be set and then `code` will be run.
If `element` is not an array, it will iterate over each character instead.
default.exampleOut:
I like apples
I like oranges
I like c#

default.description: Repeatedly executes `code` `amount` times.

value.description: This will continuously execute `code` for as long as `boolean` returns `true`.

condition.description:
This will continuously execute `code` for as long as the condition returns `true`. The condition is as follows:
If `evaluator` and `value2` are provided, `value1` is evaluated against `value2` using `evaluator`. Valid evaluators are {operators#map(`{}`)#join(, | and )}.

array.description: Gets the absolute value of each `numbers` and returns an array containing the results

default.description: Converts `integer` from a base `origin` number into a base `radix` number. `radix` and `origin` must be between 2 and 36.
Decreases `varName`'s value by `1`.

count.description: Decreases `varName`'s value by `amount`. `floor` is a boolean, and if it is `true` then the value will be rounded down.

default.description: Increases `varName`'s value by `1`.

count.description: Increases `varName`'s value by `amount`. `floor` is a boolean, and if it is `true` then the value will be rounded down.

default.description:
Accepts multiple `values` and returns the result of `operator` on them. Valid operators are {operators#map(`{}`)#join(, | and )}
See `\{operators\}` for a shorter way of performing numeric operations.
Returns the largest entry out of `numbers`. If an array is provided, it will be expanded to its individual values.
Returns the smallest entry out of `numbers`. If an array is provided, it will be expanded to its individual values.

numberFormat.description: If `roundTo` is not provided, but the number does have decimals, rounds to `3` by default. Any precision for decimals will be lost e.g: `100.000000000`becomes `100` and `100.3100000000` becomes `100.31`

default.description: Rounds `number` to `roundTo` digits. `roundTo` can be left empty.

separator.description: Rounds `number` to `roundTo` digits. Uses `decimal` as the decimal separator and `thousands` for the thousands separator. To skip `roundTo` or `decimal` leave them empty.

default.description: Returns an floating point number from `text`. If it wasn't a number, returns `NaN`.
Returns an integer from `text`. If it wasn't a number, returns `NaN`.
Chooses a random whole number between `min` and `max` (inclusive).
Rounds `number` to the nearest whole number.
Rounds `number` down.
Rounds `number` up.

delete.description: Only custom commands can delete other messages.

trigger.description: Deletes the message that invoked the command
trigger.exampleOut: (the message got deleted idk how to do examples for this)
trigger.exampleCode: \{//;The message that triggered this will be deleted\} \{delete\}

inCurrent.description: Deletes the specified `messageId` from the current channel.
inCurrent.exampleOut: (the message `111111111111111111` got deleted idk how to do examples for this)
inCurrent.exampleCode:
\{//;The message with id `111111111111111111` will be deleted\}
\{delete;111111111111111111\}

edit.description: `text` and `embed` can both be set to `_delete` to remove either the message content or embed.Please note that `embed` is the JSON for an embed object or an array of embed objects, don't put `\{embed\}` there, as nothing will show. Only messages created by the bot may be edited.

inCurrentText.description: Edits `messageId` in the current channel to say `text`

inCurrentEmbed.description: Edits `messageId` in the current channel to say `embed`

inCurrentFull.description: Edits `messageId` in the current channel to say `text` and `embed`

default.description:
Takes whatever input you pass to `embed` and attempts to form an embed from it. `embed` must be a valid json embed object. Multiple embeds can be provided.
This subtag works well with `\{embedBuild\}`. If attempting to use inside of a `\{send\}`, `\{edit\}` or `\{dm\}`, you should not include `\{embed\}`, and instead just pass the content direct to `\{send\}`/`\{edit\}`/`\{dm\}`
You can find information about embeds [here (embed structure)](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object) and [here (embed limits)](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-limits) as well as a useful tool for testing embeds [here](https://leovoel.github.io/embed-visualizer/)

embedBuild.description:
This tag is designed to allow you to generate embed code for `\{webhook\}` and `\{embed\}` with much less effort.
This tag uses a key/value system, with each entry in `values` looking like `key:value`.

Valid keys are:
{keys#map(`{}`)#join(, )}

You can find information about embeds [here (embed structure)](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object) and [here (embed limits)](https://discordapp.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-limits) as well as a useful tool for testing embeds [here](https://leovoel.github.io/embed-visualizer/)

default.description: Builds the embed json
default.exampleOut: \{"title":"hello!","description":"I am an example embed","fields":[\{"name":"Field 1","value":"This is the first field!"\},\{"name":"Field 2","value":"This is the next field and is inline!","inline":true\}]\}

default.description:
Returns the mention of `@everyone`.
This requires the `disableeveryone` setting to be false. If `mention` is set to `true`, `@everyone` will ping, else it will be silent.
Sets the output attachment to the provided `file` and `filename`. If `file` starts with `buffer:`, the following text will be parsed as base64 to a raw buffer - useful for uploading images.

Returns the mention of `@here`.
This requires the `disableeveryone` setting to be false. If `mention` is set to `true`, `@here` will ping, else it will be silent.

trigger.description: Returns an array of attachments of the invoking message.

inCurrent.description: Returns an array of attachments of `messageId` in the current channel
inCurrent.exampleOut: Someone sent a message with attachments: "["https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1111111111111/111111111111111/thisisntreal.png"]"
inCurrent.exampleCode: Someone sent a message with attachments: "\{messageAttachments;1111111111111\}"

inOther.description: Returns an array of attachments of `messageId` from `channel`. If `quiet` is provided and `channel` cannot be found, this will return an empty array.
inOther.exampleOut: Someone sent a message in #support with attachments: "["https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1111111111111/111111111111111/thisisntreal.png"]"
inOther.exampleCode: Someone sent a message in #support with attachments: "\{messageAttachments;support;1111111111111\}"

messageEditTime.description:
If the message is not edited, this will return the current time instead.

**Note:** there are plans to change this behaviour, but due to backwards-compatibility this remains unchanged.

trigger.description: Returns the edit time of the executing message in `format`
trigger.exampleOut: The edit timestamp of your message is "1628782144703"
trigger.exampleCode: The edit timestamp of your message is "\{messageEditTime\}"

inCurrent.description: Returns the edit time of `messageId` in `format`
inCurrent.exampleOut: The edit timestamp of message 11111111111111 is "1628782144703"
inCurrent.exampleCode: The edit timestamp of message 11111111111111 is "\{messageEditTime;11111111111111\}

inOther.description: Returns the edit time of `messageId` from `channel` in `format`.

trigger.description: Returns an array of embeds of the invoking message.

inCurrent.description: Returns an array of embeds of `messageId` in the current channel
inCurrent.exampleOut: Someone sent a message with attachments: "[\{"title":"Hello!"\}]"
inCurrent.exampleCode: Someone sent a message with embeds: "\{messageEmbeds;1111111111111\}"

inOther.description: Returns an array of embeds of `messageId` from `channel`. If `quiet` is provided and `channel` cannot be found, this will return an empty array.
inOther.exampleOut: Someone sent a message in #support with embeds: "[\{"title":"Hello!"\}]"
inOther.exampleCode: Someone sent a message in #support with embeds: "\{messageEmbeds;support;1111111111111\}"

default.description: Returns the id of the invoking message.

trigger.description: Returns the id of the invoking message's parent message.

inCurrent.description: Returns the id of the parent message of the provided `message`.

inOther.description: Returns the id of the parent message of the provided `message`.

trigger.description: Returns the id of the author of the executing message.

inCurrent.description: Returns the id of the author of `messageId` in the current channel.

inOther.description: Returns the id of the author of `messageId` in `channel`. If `quiet` is provided and `channel` cannot be found, this will return nothing.

trigger.description: Returns the text of the executing message.

inCurrent.description: Returns the text of `messageId` in the current channel.

inOther.description: Returns the text of `messageId` in `channel`. If `quiet` is provided and `channel` cannot be found, this will return nothing.

trigger.description: Returns the send time of the executing message in `format`
trigger.exampleOut: The send timestamp of your message is "1628782144703"
trigger.exampleCode: The send timestamp of your message is "\{messageTime\}"

inCurrent.description: Returns the send time of `messageId` in `format`
inCurrent.exampleOut: The send timestamp of message 11111111111111 is "1628782144703"
inCurrent.exampleCode: The send timestamp of message 11111111111111 is "\{messageTime;11111111111111\}

inOther.description: Returns the send time of `messageId` from `channel` in `format`.

messageType.description: For more info about message types, visit the [discord docs](https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object-message-types).

trigger.description: Returns the message type of the executing message.

other.description:
`channel` defaults to the current channel.

Returns the message type of `messageId` in `channel`

default.description:
Forces an early send of the default output message, using `text` as the text to show. If this is used then there will be no output sent once the tag finishes. Only 1 `\{output\}` may be used per tag/cc. If a second `\{output\}` is used then the result of the first `\{output\}` will be returned instead.
The message id of the output that was sent will be returned.

reactionAdd.description: Please note that to be able to add a reaction, I must be on the server that you got that reaction from. If I am not, then I will return an error if you are trying to apply the reaction to another message.

output.description: Adds `reactions` to the output message of this tag.
output.exampleOut: This will have reactions! (reacted with 🤔 and 👀)

inCurrent.description: Adds `reactions` to `messageId` in the current channel.

inOther.description: Adds `reactions` to `messageId` in `channelId`. `channelId` must be an id, use of `\{channelId\} is advised`.

default.description: Gets the reaction that triggered \{waitReaction\}
Gets the user whose reaction that triggered \{waitReaction\}

reactions.description: Returns an array of reactions on `messageId` in `channelId`.

users.description: Returns an array of users who reacted `reactions` on `messageId` in `channelId`. A user only needs to react to one reaction to be included in the resulting array.

all.description: Removes all reactions of the executing user from `messageId` in `channel`.

user.description: Removes `reactions` `user` reacted on `messageId` in `channel`.

default.description:
Removes all reactions from `messageId`.
`channelId` defaults to the current channel.

send.description: If `embed` is an array, multiple embeds will be added to the message payload.

full.description:
Sends `message` and `embed` to `channel` with an attachment, and returns the message id. `channel` is either an id or channel mention. If `fileContent` starts with `buffer:` then the following text will be parsed as base64 to a raw buffer.
**Note:** `embed` is the JSON for an embed, don't put the `\{embed\}` subtag there, as nothing will show
full.exampleCode: \{send;\{channelId\};Hello there!;\{embedBuild;title:This is a cool embed\};Wow, look at this text file!;test.txt\}

textAndEmbed.description:
Sends `message` and `embed` to `channel`, and returns the message id. `channel` is either an id or channel mention.
**Note:** `embed` is the JSON for an embed, don't put the `\{embed\}` subtag there, as nothing will show

textOrEmbed.description:
Sends `content` to `channel`, and returns the message id. `channel` is either an id or channel mention.
**Note:** `content` is the text to send or the JSON for an embed, don't put the `\{embed\}` subtag there, as nothing will show

waitMessage.description:
Pauses the command until one of the given users sends a message in any of the given channels. When a message is sent, `condition` will be run to determine if the message can be accepted. If no message has been accepted within `timeout` then the subtag returns `Wait timed out`, otherwise it returns an array containing the channel id, then the message id. 

`channels` defaults to the current channel.
`users` defaults to the current user.
`condition` must return `true` or `false`
`timeout` is a number of seconds. This is limited to 300

 While inside the `condition` parameter, none of the following subtags may be used: {disabled#map(`{}`)#join(, )}
Also, the current message becomes the users message that is to be checked. This means that `\{channelId\}`, `\{messageId\}`, `\{userId\}` and all related subtags will change their values.

default.description: Pauses the command until the executing user sends a message in the current channel.

filtered.description: Pauses the command until `condition` returns true when one of `userIds` sends a message in one of `channelIds`.

waitReaction.description:
Pauses the command until one of the given `users` adds any given `reaction` on any of the given `messages`. When a `reaction` is added, `condition` will be run to determine if the reaction can be accepted. If no reaction has been accepted within `timeout` then the subtag returns `Wait timed out`, otherwise it returns an array containing the channel id, the message id, the user id and the reaction, in that order. 

`userIds` defaults to the current user if left blank or omitted.
`reactions` defaults to any reaction if left blank or omitted.
`condition` must return `true` or `false`
`timeout` is a number of seconds. This is limited to 300

 While inside the `condition` parameter, none of the following subtags may be used: {disabled#map(`{}`)#join(, )}
Also, the current message becomes the message the reaction was added to, and the user becomes the person who sent the message. This means that `\{channelId\}`, `\{messageId\}`, `\{userId\}` and all related subtags will change their values.
Finally, while inside the `condition` parameter, you can use the temporary subtag `\{reaction\}` to get the current reaction and the `\{reactionUser\}` temporary subtag to get the user who reacted.
`messages`, `users` and `reactions` can either be single values eg: `\{waitReaction;1234567891234;stupid cat;🤔\}`, or they can be arrays eg: `\{waitReaction;["1234567891234","98765432219876"];stupid cat;["🤔"]\}

default.description: Waits for any reaction on `messages` from the executing user or `userIds` if provided.

filtered.description: Waits for any of `reactions` on `messages` from `userIds`, if `condition` returns `true` this will return the response array. If no reaction was matched within `timeout`, `Wait timed out` will be returned.
filtered.exampleIn:
(some random user reacted with 🤔)
(blargbot reacted with 🤔)

webhook.description:
Please assign your webhook credentials to private variables! Do not leave them in your code.
`embed` can be an array of embed objects.

empty.exampleOut: Error executing webhook: Cannot send an empty message

default.description: Executes a webhook. If `embed` is provided it must be provided in a raw JSON format, properly escaped for BBTag. Using `\{json\}` is advised.
default.exampleOut: (in the webhook channel) This is the webhook content! (and with an embed with the title "This is the embed title" idk how to make this example)
default.exampleCode: \{webhook;1111111111111111;t.OK-en;This is the webhook content!;\{json;\{"title":"This is the embed title!"\}\}\}

withUser.description: Executes a webhook. `avatarURL` must be a valid URL.
withUser.exampleOut: (in the webhook channel) Some content! (sent by "Not blargbot" with blargbot's pfp

withFile.description: Executes a webhook. If file starts with buffer:, the following text will be parsed as base64 to a raw buffer.
withFile.exampleOut: (in the webhook channel a file labeled readme.txt containing "Hello, world!")

default.description: Converts the provided base64 to a UTF-8 string.
Converts the provided text to base64.

Evaluates `arg1` and `arg2` using the `evaluator` and returns `true` or `false`. Valid evaluators are {operators#map(`{}`)#join(, | and )}
The positions of `evaluator` and `arg1` can be swapped.
Interprets `code` as brainfuck, using `input` as the text for `,`.

ignoreRest.description: Capitalizes the first letter of `text`, leaves the rest of the text untouched.

restLower.description: Capitalizes the first letter of `text`, and converts the rest to lowercase.
restLower.exampleOut:
Hello world
Hello world
Foo bar

default.description: Chooses from the given `options`, where `choice` is the index of the option to select.
default.exampleOut: I feel like eating pie today.

default.description: Removes all duplicated whitespace from `text`, meaning a cleaner output.

color.description: If `inputFormat` is omitted or left empty, the format of `color` is automatically calculated, but might be inaccurate. For accuracy and known `color` formats use `inputFormat`. It converts all ways between `rgb`, `hsl`, `hsv`, `hwb`, `cmyk`, `ansi16`, `hex` strings, and CSS `keyword`s (will round to closest).

default.description: Converts a color to `outputFormat`.

convert.description: Converts a color of `inputFormat` to `outputFormat`. If `inputFormat` is left empty, it will be automatically calculated.

default.description: Does nothing. Your code is simply ignored.
default.exampleCode: This is a sentence. \{//;This is a comment.\}

default.description: Returns the decancered version of `text`.

Returns `input` without resolving any BBTagThis effectively returns the characters `\{`, `\}` and `;` as is, without the use of `\{rb\}`, `\{lb\}` and `\{semi\}`.
**NOTE:** Brackets inside code must come in pairs. A `\{` has to be followed by a `\}` somewhere and a `\} has to have a \{` before it

basic.description:
Returns the numeric hash of `text`, based on the unicode value of each individual character. This results in seemingly randomly generated numbers that are constant for each specific query.
NOTE: This hash isn't a particularly robust one, it is a quick implementation that was thrown together. To use a proper hash function, specify the `algorithm`

secure.description:
Performs a hash on the given `text`. If the `text` starts with `buffer:` then it will first be decoded as a base64 string. If it starts with `text:` then it will be treated as plaintext. The hash result will be returned as a hex number.
Supported `algorithm`s are: {methods#map(`{}`)#join(, )}

default.description: Decodes html entities from `text`.
Encodes `text` with escaped html entities.

if.description:
If `evaluator` and `value2` are provided, `value1` is evaluated against `value2` using `evaluator`. If they are not provided, `value1` is read as `true` or `false`. If the resulting value is `true` then the tag returns `then`, otherwise it returns `else`.
Valid evaluators are {operators#map(`{}`)#join(, | and )}.

value.description: If `boolean` is `true`, return `then`, else do nothing.

valueElse.exampleCode: \{if;\{isCustomCommand\};This is a custom command!;This isn't a custom command!\}

conditionThen.description: `Value1` is evaluated against `value2` using `evaluator`, if the resulting value is `true` then the tag returns `then`.

conditionElse.description: `Value1` is evaluated against `value2` using `evaluator`, if the resulting value is `true` then the tag returns `then`, otherwise it returns `else`

default.description: Finds the index of `searchFor` in `text|array`, after `start`. `text|array` can either be plain text or an array. If it's not found, returns -1.
default.exampleOut: The index of "o" in "hello world" is 4
default.exampleCode: The index of "o" in "hello world" is \{indexof;hello world;o\}

default.description: Specifies which `language` should be used when viewing the raw of this tag
default.exampleOut: This will be displayed with js!.
default.exampleCode: This will be displayed with js! \{lang;js\}.

default.description: Gives the amount of characters in `value`, or the number of elements if it is an array.
default.exampleOut: What you said is 5 chars long.
default.exampleCode: What you said is \{length;\{args\}\} chars long.

default.description: Accepts 1 or more boolean `values` (`true` or `false`) and returns the result of `operator` on them. Valid logic operators are {operators#map(`{}`)#join(, | and )}.See `\{operators\}` for a shorter way of performing logic operations.
Returns `text` as lowercase.
Converts the provided text to md5.
Will be replaced by `count` newline characters (\n).

%.description: Returns the remainder after dividing each pair of `value`s.

*.description: Returns the result from multiplying all the `value`s together

+.description: Returns the result from summing all the `values`s together

-.description: Returns the result from subtracting all the `value`s from the first

/.description: Returns the result from dividing the first `value` by all the rest

^.description: Returns the result of raising the first `value` to the power of all the rest

<.description: Returns `true` if each `value` is less than the value after it, otherwise `false`

<=.description: Returns `true` if each `value` is less than or equal to the value after it, otherwise `false`

!=.description: Returns `true` if all pairs of `value`s are not equal

==.description: Returns `true` if all `value`s are equal, otherwise `false`

>.description: Returns `true` if each `value` is greater than the value after it, otherwise `false`

>=.description: Returns `true` if each `value` is greater than or equal to the value after it, otherwise `false`

!.description: Inverts a boolean `value`. All values after the first one are ignored.

&&.description: Returns `true` if all of the `value`s are `true`, otherwise `false`

||.description: Returns `true` if any of the `value`s are `true`, otherwise `false`

xor.description: Returns `true` if exactly 1 of the `value`s are `true`, otherwise `false`

contains.description: Returns `true` if the first `value` contains all the rest. If the first `value` is an array then the array must contain all the remaining values.

includes.description: Returns `true` if the first `value` contains all the rest. If the first `value` is an array then the array must contain all the remaining values.

endswith.description: Returns `true` if the first `value` ends with all the rest. If the first `value` is an array then the last element must equal all the remaining values.

startswith.description: Returns `true` if the first `value` starts with all the rest. If the first `value` is an array then the first element must equal all the remaining values.

??.description: Returns the first non-empty value given.

default.description: Places `text` on top of `back` with it being aligned to the opposite of `direction`. If `text` is longer than `back` then it will simply overlap

array.exampleOut: I feel like eating pie today

args.exampleOut: I feel like eating pudding today.

default.description: Creates a random string with characters from `chars` that is `length` characters long.
Pads `text` using space until it has `length` characters. Spaces are added on the right side.

withDirection.description: Pads `text` using `filler` until it has `length` characters. `filler` is applied to the  `direction` of `text`.

default.description: Returns an array of everything in `text` that matches `regex`. Any bbtag in `regex` will not be resolved. Please consider using `\{apply\}` for a dynamic regex. `regex` will only succeed to compile if it is deemed a safe regular expression (safe regexes do not run in exponential time for any input)

regexReplace.description: Any bbtag in `regex` will not be resolved. Please consider using `\{apply\}` for a dynamic regex. `regex` will only succeed to compile if it is deemed a safe regular expression (safe regexes do not run in exponential time for any input)

output.description: Replaces the `regex` phrase with `replaceWith`. This is executed on the output of the containing tag.

text.description: Replace the `regex` phrase with `replaceWith`. This is executed on `text`.

default.description: Splits the given text using the given `regex` as the split rule. Any bbtag in `regex` will not be resolved. Please consider using `\{apply\}` for a dynamic regex. `regex` will only succeed to compile if it is deemed a safe regular expression (safe regexes do not run in exponential time for any input)

Tests if the `regex` phrase matches the `text`, and returns a boolean (true/false). Any bbtag in `regex` will not be resolved. Please consider using `\{apply\}` for a dynamic regex. `regex` will only succeed to compile if it is deemed a safe regular expression (safe regexes do not run in exponential time for any input)

output.description: Replaces the first occurrence of `phrase` with `replaceWith`. This is executed on the output from the containing tag.

text.description: Replaces the first occurrence of `phrase` in `text` with `replaceWith`.
text.exampleOut: I like to nom ham. ham

default.description: Reverses the order of `text`. If `text` is an array, the array will be reversed. If `\{get\}` is used with an array, this will modify the original array.
Will be replaced by `count` spaces. If `count` is less than `0`, no spaces will be returned.
Returns all text from `text` between the `start` and `end`. `end` defaults to the length of text.

Compares `value` against each `case` and executes the first `then` that matches. If no matches are found, `default` is executed. Each `case` can optionally be an array to allow matching against multiple values.
default.exampleOut: Got it, i'll hit Danny for you!

time.description:
If you provide `time`, you should also provide `parseFormat` to ensure it is being interpreted correctly.
See the [moment documentation](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) for more format information.
See [here](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/parsing/) for parsing documentation. See [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) for a list of timezone codes.

default.description: `time` is in `fromTimezone` and converted to `toTimezone` using `format`.
default.exampleOut:
Time Berlin (as toTimezone): 23:33
Berlin from UTC 12:00: 13:00
Berlin (as fromTimezone): 23:33
Berlin (as fromTimezone and empty toTimezone): 21:33
New York from Berlin (12:00 in Berlin): 06:00

default.description: Trims whitespace and newlines before and after `text`.
Unindents text (or code!). If no level is provided, attempts to guess the indentation level past the first line.
Returns `text` as uppercase.
Decodes `text` from URI format.
Encodes `text` in URI format. Useful for constructing links.
Executes `code` but does not return the output from it. Useful for silent functionality

roleAdd.description: `role` can be either a roleId or role mention.

target.description: Gives the executing user `role`. Returns `true` if role was given, else an error will be shown.

other.description: Gives `user` the chosen `role`. Returns `true` if role was given, else an error will be shown. If `quiet` is specified, if a user can't be found it will simply return `false`
other.exampleOut: Stupid cat have a role! true
other.exampleCode: Stupid cat have a role! \{roleAdd;Bot;Stupid cat\}

default.description: Returns `role`'s hex color code. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

`color` can be a [HTML color](https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp), hex, (r,g,b) or a valid color number. Provide `permissions` as a number, which can be calculated [here](https://discordapi.com/permissions.html) `hoisted` is if the role should be displayed separately from other roles.
Returns the new role's id.

Deletes `role`. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will return nothing.
Warning: this subtag is able to delete roles managed by integrations.
default.exampleOut: (rip no more super cool roles for anyone)

default.description: Returns `role`'s id. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
Returns an array of members in `role`. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
Returns a mention of `role`. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
default.exampleOut: The admin role will be mentioned: @Administrator
default.exampleCode: The admin role will be mentioned: \{roleMention;Admin\}

default.description: Returns `role`'s name. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
default.exampleOut: The admin role name is: Administrator.

default.description: Returns `role`'s permission number. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

Returns the position of `role`. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
**Note**: the highest role will have the highest position, and the lowest role will have the lowest position and therefore return `0` (`@everyone`).

roleRemove.description: `role` can be either a roleId or role mention.

target.description: Removes `role` from the executing user. Returns `true` if role was removed, else an error will be shown.

other.description: Remove the chosen `role` from  `user`. Returns `true` if role was removed, else an error will be shown. If `quiet` is specified, if a user can't be found it will simply return `false`
other.exampleOut: Stupid cat no more role! true
other.exampleCode: Stupid cat no more role! \{roleRemove;Bot;Stupid cat\}

guild.description: Returns an array of roles on the current guild.
guild.exampleCode: The roles on this guild are: \{roles\}.

user.description: Returns `user`'s roles in the current guild. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleCode: Stupid cat has the roles: \{roles;Stupid cat\}

clear.description: Sets the color of `role` to '#000000'. This is transparent.
clear.exampleOut: The admin role is now colourless.
clear.exampleCode: The admin role is now colourless. \{roleSetColor;admin\}

set.description: Sets the `color` of `role`.If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing
set.exampleOut: The admin role is now white.
set.exampleCode: The admin role is now white. \{roleSetColor;admin;white\}

enable.exampleOut: The admin role is now mentionable.
enable.exampleCode: The admin role is now mentionable. \{roleSetMentionable;admin\}

set.description: Sets whether `role` can be mentioned. `value` can be either `true` to set the role as mentionable, or anything else to set it to unmentionable. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing
set.exampleOut: The admin role is no longer mentionable.
set.exampleCode: The admin role is no longer mentionable. \{roleSetMentionable;admin;false\}

default.description: Sets the name of `role`.If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing
default.exampleOut: The admin role is now called administrator.
default.exampleCode: The admin role is now called administrator. \{roleSetName;admin;administrator\}

set.description: Sets the permissions of `role` with the provided `permissions` number. This will not apply any permissions the authorizer can't grant. Additionally, this will completely overwrite the role's existing permissions. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing
set.exampleOut: The admin role now has the administrator permission.
set.exampleCode: The admin role now has the administrator permission. \{roleSetPermissions;admin;8\}

default.description: Sets the position of `role`. If `quiet` is specified, if `role` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
default.exampleOut: The admin role is now at position 3.
default.exampleCode: The admin role is now at position 3. \{roleSetPosition;admin;3\}

default.description: Returns the amount of people in role `role`
default.exampleOut: There are 5 people in the role!
default.exampleCode: There are \{roleSize;11111111111111111\} people in the role!

default.description: Gets user input as an array.
Return the number of arguments the user provided.
Checks if the tag is being run from within a cc. Returns a boolean (`true` or `false`)
default.exampleOut: Boo, this only works in cc's
default.exampleCode: \{if;\{isCustomCommand\};\{dm;\{userId\};You have mail!\};Boo, this only works in cc's\}

lb.description: Will be replaced by `\{` on execution.

default.description: Returns `\{`
Returns `\}`
Returns `;`
Returns the user id of the tag/cc author
default.exampleOut: This tag was created by stupid cat

default.description: Returns the user id of the tag/cc authorizer
Returns a single zero width space (unicode 200B)

ban.description: `daysToDelete` is the number of days to delete messages for. `duration`

default.description: Bans `user`. If the ban is successful `true` will be returned, else it will return an error.

withReason.exampleOut: true (stupid cat will be unbanned after 30d)

noPerms.description: Bans `user` for duration `timeToUnban` with `reason`. If `noPerms` is provided and not an empty string, do not check if the command executor is actually able to ban people.Only provide this if you know what you're doing.
noPerms.exampleOut: true (anyone can use this cc regardless of perms)

text.description: DMs `user` the given `message`. You may only send one DM per execution. Requires author to be staff, and the user to be on the current guild.

embed.description:
DMs `user` the given `embed`. You may only send one DM per execution. Requires author to be staff, and the user to be on the current guild.
Please note that `embed` is the JSON for an embed object, don't put the `\{embed\}` subtag there, as nothing will show.

full.description:
DMs `user` the given `message` and `embed`. You may only send one DM per execution. Requires author to be staff, and the user to be on the current guild.
Please note that `embed` is the JSON for an embed object, don't put the `\{embed\}` subtag there, as nothing will show.

target.description: Checks if the tag author is staff
target.exampleOut: The author is a staff member!
target.exampleCode: \{if;\{isStaff\};The author is a staff member!;The author is not a staff member :(\}

user.description: Checks if `user` is a member of staff. If the `user` cannot be found `false` will be returned.
user.exampleOut: You are not a staff member :(
user.exampleCode: \{if;\{isStaff;\{userId\}\};You are a staff member!;You are not a staff member :(\}

target.description: Returns `true` if the executing user is boosting the guild and `false` if not.
target.exampleCode: \{if;\{isUserBoosting\};Yes you are boosting;You should consider boosting\}

user.description: Returns `true` if the `user` is boosting the guild and `false` if not. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleCode: \{if;\{isUserBoosting;stupid cat\};stupid cat is boosting!; no boosting here :(\}

kick.description: If the kick is successful, `Success` will be returned, otherwise the error will be given.

default.description: Kicks `user`.

withReason.description: Kicks `user`. If `noPerms` is provided and not an empty string, do not check if the command executor is actually able to kick people. Only provide this if you know what you're doing.
withReason.exampleOut: Success @stupid cat was kicked, because I can!
withReason.exampleCode: \{kick;stupid cat;because I can\} @stupid cat was kicked!

pardon.description: `user` defaults to the executing user. Returns the new warning count

default.description: Gives `user` one pardon.

withReason.exampleCode: Be pardoned 9001 times, Stupid cat! \{pardon;Stupid cat;9001\}

default.description: Returns the id of a random user on the current guild.
default.exampleOut: abalabahaha is a lovely person! stupid cat isn't as good.
default.exampleCode: \{username;\{randomUser\}\} is a lovely person! \{username;\{randomUser\}\} isn't as good.

timeout.description: If the timeout is successful, `Success` will be returned, otherwise the error will be given.

default.description: Times out `user` for the specified amount of time. Maximum is 28 days.
default.exampleOut: Success @stupid cat was timed out for 1 day!
default.exampleCode: \{timeout;stupid cat;1d\} @stupid cat was timed out for 1 day!

withReason.description: Times out `user` for the specified amount of time. Maximum is 28 days.If `noPerms` is provided and not an empty string, do not check if the command executor is actually able to time out people. Only provide this if you know what you're doing.
withReason.exampleOut: Success @stupid cat was timed out for 1 day, because I can!
withReason.exampleCode: \{timeout;stupid cat;1d;because I can\} @stupid cat was timed out for 1 day!

default.description: Unbans `user`.

withReason.description: Unbans `user` with the given `reason`.If `noPerms` is provided and not an empty string, do not check if the command executor is actually able to ban people. Only provide this if you know what you're doing.
withReason.exampleCode: \{unban;@stupid cat;I made a mistake\} @stupid cat has been unbanned

userActivity.description: If no game is being played, this will return 'nothing'

target.description: Returns the name of the activity the executing user is currently doing.
target.exampleOut: You are listening to bad music

user.description: Returns the name of the activity `user` is currently doing. If `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

userActivityType.description: Activity types can be any of {types#map(`{}`)#join(, | or )}

target.description: Returns the type of activity the executing user is currently doing (playing, streaming).

user.description: Returns the activity type `user` is currently doing. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

userAvatar.description: If no game is being played, this will return 'nothing'

target.description: Returns the avatar of the executing user.

user.description: Returns the avatar of `user`. If `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

userBoostDate.description: See the [moment documentation](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) for more information about formats. If user is not boosting the guild, returns `User not boosting`

target.description: Returns the date that the executing user started boosting the guild using `format` for the output, in UTC+0.
target.exampleOut: Your account started boosting this guild on 2020/02/27 00:00:00
target.exampleCode: Your account started boosting this guild on \{userBoostDate;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss\}

user.description: Returns the date that `user` started boosting the current guild using `format` for the output, in UTC+0. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: Stupid cat started boosting this guild on 2020/02/27 00:00:00
user.exampleCode: Stupid cat started boosting this guild on \{userBoostDate;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss;stupid cat\}

target.description: Returns the account creation date of the executing user in `format`.

user.description: Returns the account creation date of `user` in `format`. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: Stupid cat's account was created on 2015-10-13T04:27:26Z
user.exampleCode: Stupid cat's account was created on \{userCreatedAt;;Stupid cat\}

userDiscriminator.description: If no game is being played, this will return 'nothing'

target.description: Returns the discriminator of the executing user.

user.description: Returns `user`'s discriminator. If `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

userHasRole.description:
This subtag checks if a user has *any* of the provided `roleIds`. Use `\{userHasRoles\}` to check if a user has *all* of the provided `roleIds`. `roleIds` can be an array of role ids, or a single role id. For a list of roles and their corresponding ids, use `b!roles`
Returns a boolean.

target.description: Checks if the executing user has *any* of the provided `roleIds`.
target.exampleCode: \{if;\{userHasRole;\{roleId;moderator\}\};You are a moderator; You are not a moderator\}

user.description: Checks if `user` has *any* of the provided `roleIds`. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` or any `roleId` can't be found it will simply return `false`.
user.exampleCode: \{if;\{userHasRole;\{userId;moderator\};Stupid cat\};Stupid cat is a moderator;Stupid cat is not a moderator\}

userHasRoles.description:
This subtag checks if a user has *all* of the provided `roleIds`. Use `\{userHasRole\}` to check if a user has *any* of the provided `roleIds`. `roleIds` can be an array of role ids, or a single role id. For a list of roles and their corresponding ids, use `b!roles`
Returns a boolean.

target.description: Checks if the executing user has *all* of the provided `roleIds`.
target.exampleOut: You are not a moderator and admin
target.exampleCode: \{if;\{userHasRoles;["\{roleId;moderator\}","\{roleId;admin\}"];You are a moderator and admin; You are not a moderator and admin\}

user.description: Checks if `user` has *all* of the provided `roleIds`. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` or any `roleId` can't be found it will simply return `false`.
user.exampleOut: Stupid cat is a moderator and admin
user.exampleCode: \{if;\{userHasRoles;["\{roleId;moderator\}","\{roleId;admin\}"];Stupid cat\};Stupid cat is a moderator and admin;Stupid cat is not a moderator and admin\}

target.description: Returns the user id of the executing user.

user.description: Returns `user`'s id. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: This is Stupid cat's user id 103347843934212096
user.exampleCode: This is Stupid cat's user id \{userId;Stupid cat\}

target.description: Returns whether the executing user is a bot.

user.description: Returns whether a `user` is a bot. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: Is Stupid cat a bot? false
user.exampleCode: Is Stupid cat a bot? \{userIsBot;Stupid cat\}

userJoinedAt.description: For a list of formats see the [moment documentation](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) for more information.

target.description: Returns the date that the executing user joined the guild, using `format` for the output, in UTC+0.
target.exampleOut: Your account joined this guild on 2016/01/01 01:00:00.
target.exampleCode: Your account joined this guild on \{userJoinedAt;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss\}

user.description: Returns the date that `user` joined the current guild using `format` for the output, in UTC+0. if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: Stupid cat joined this guild on 2016/06/19 23:30:30
user.exampleCode: Stupid cat joined this guild on \{userJoinedAt;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss;Stupid cat\}

target.description: Mentions the executing user.

user.description: Mentions `user`. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

target.description: Returns the username of the executing user.

user.description: Returns `user`'s username. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: Stupid cat's username is Stupid cat!

target.description: Returns the nickname of the executing user.

user.description: Returns `user`'s nickname. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: Stupid cat's nickname is Secretly Awoken

target.description: Returns the roles of the executing user.

user.description: Returns `user`'s roles as an array. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

default.description: Sets `user`'s nickname to `nick`. Leave `nick` blank to reset their nickname.

userSetRoles.description: `roleArray` must be an array formatted like `["role1", "role2"]`

target.description: Sets the roles of the current user to `roleArray`.

user.description: Sets the roles of `user` to `roleArray`. If quiet is provided, all errors will return `false`.

userStatus.description: Returned status can be one of `online`, `idle`, `dnd` or `offline`

target.description: Returns the status of the user.

user.description: Returns the status of `user`. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.

userTimeout.description: See the [moment documentation](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/) for more information about formats. If user has never been timed out in the guild, returns `User not timed out`

target.description: Returns the executing user's timeout date using `format` for the output, in UTC+0.
target.exampleOut: You have been timed out until 2021/01/01 00:00:00
target.exampleCode: You have been timed out until \{userTimeout;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss\}

user.description: Returns a `user`'s timeout date using `format` for the output, in UTC+0. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.
user.exampleOut: stupid cat is timed out until 2021/01/01 00:00:00
user.exampleCode: stupid cat is timed out until \{userTimeout;YYYY/MM/DD HH:mm:ss;stupid cat\}

target.description: Returns the set timezone of the user executing the containing tag.

user.description: Returns the set timezone code of the specified `user`. If `quiet` is specified, if `user` can't be found it will simply return nothing.If the user has no set timezone, the output will be UTC.

default.description: Gives `user` one warning. This will return the amount of warnings `user` has after executing.

withReason.exampleCode: Be warned Stupid cat! \{warn;Stupid cat;9001;For being too cool\}

default.description: Gets the number of warnings `user` has. `user` defaults to the user who executed the containing tag.
